Review Text: This is a series based on Stephen King's story.  King's movies often suffer from mediocre actors.  The story lines would often suffer as well.  Not so with this series.  It has very nice acting, a great story line, and terrific special effects for the dome.  I hope this continues to be the case in season 2.

Review Text: All cartoons.  No live cast.  I was hoping this would have the live band performing in each episode.  I wanted to reminisce about those days when I was an 11 year old boy with raging hormones.  I was curious to see if "Betty" and "Veronica" were as hot as I remembered.  But there weren't in the first episode and I couldn't sit thru any more.
Review Title: Where's the live girls I remembered on this show?

Review Text: Excellent storylines, characters, and special effects.  Can't wait to see Season 3.  FYI:  I'm not a full-on fan that loves everything his done.  So this is a more balanced review.  I AM a fan of several of his books.  I read all his early novels as soon as they came out.  That ended in the late 80's.  I'm more selective now.  It's the same with his movie and TV productions.  They can really be hit and miss.  I think most scifi fans will enjoy this series.
Review Title: Surprisingly good for a Stephen King adaptation!
Rating: 5.0

Review Text: Excellent storylines, characters, and special effects.  Can't wait to see Season 3.  FYI:  I'm not a full-on fan that loves everything his done.  So this is a more balanced review.  I AM a fan of several of his books.  I read all his early novels as soon as they came out.  That ended in the late 80's.  I'm more selective now.  It's the same with his movie and TV productions.  They can really be hit and miss.  I think most scifi fans will enjoy this series.

raw_response:
**Purchase Summary:**

- **Genre Preferences:** Strong preference for horror, sci-fi, and thrillers, particularly adaptations of Stephen King’s works and classic horror films.
- **Content Advisory:** Frequent purchases contain elements of violence, sexual content, and foul language.
- **Ratings:** Tends to favor works with high ratings (4+), especially when storylines and character development are compelling.
- **Mixed Feedback:** Shows a tendency to rate series and films inconsistently, with high ratings for well-produced content and very low ratings for poor acting or plots.
- **Nostalgia:** Expresses curiosity for nostalgic titles, particularly animated series from childhood, but critiques if they don’t meet expectations.
- **Language Accessibility:** Generally prefers English audio, with a dislike for subtitles unless the story is engaging enough to overlook language barriers.
- **Audience Awareness:** Enjoys content suitable for family but also appreciates humor and dark themes in horror genres.
- **Turn-offs:** Demonstrated a shift away from darker themes due to personal beliefs, impacting continued viewership.
- **Engagement:** Reacts positively to strong performances, special effects, and plot twists, indicating a decisive taste for quality over quantity.
- **Key Names:** Frequent mention of renowned actors and directors, particularly those associated with horror and sci-fi genres. 

Overall, the pattern shows a viewer who is selective, valuing high-quality storytelling and presentation across favored genres, with a growing inclination towards more positive, light-hearted themes.

target_interaction.title: Not bad.
target_interaction.text: It was a mediocre movie back in 1985.  It hasn't improved with age.  It was a good movie...not a great movie and not a bad movie.  Like I said, it was just mediocre. It had 2 big-time actors, Gary Busey and a very young Corey Haim.
